radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver is normal in echotexture without focal lesions. There is no intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation. The CBD is normal and measures 4 mm in diameter. Numerous stones are noted in the gallbladder which is minimally distended. The gallbladder wall is markedly thickened and edematous, measuring up to 10 mm in diameter. There is no perihepatic or pericholecystic fluid. Small lymph nodes in the porta hepatis measure up to 7 mm in short axis, not pathologically enlarged, likely reactive. The visualized right kidney is unremarkable. Examination of the right lower quadrant was performed and the appendix was not visualized.
